name: Conventional Generation Technology
tagline: MEng Electronic Engineering with Power Systems
body:
### Project Authors
[**Thomas J. Smith**](http://uk.linkedin.com/in/thomasjsmithmeng) @TheSmiff

### Abstract
The aims of the module were:
* To introduce the conventional technologies used for generating electricity,
* To develop awareness of the technical problems associated with operation of different types of power plants,
* To gain understanding of the complex systems involved in generation of electricity,
* To challenge the conventional views towards power generation industry,
* To get novel ideas supporting the sustainability of power generation.

This included generating two sets of coursework. The first was to generate a future energy strategy for an assigned country. This took place in an individual report and a group presentation.

Find the brief here: [Brief.pdf](https://github.com/TheSmiff/Conventional-Generation-Technology/blob/master/ELEC6115_Assignement1_2013.pdf?raw=true)

Find the individual report here: [Report.pdf](https://github.com/TheSmiff/Conventional-Generation-Technology/blob/master/Thomas%20Smith%20Energy%20Policy.pdf?raw=true)

Find the presentation here: [Presentation.pptx](https://github.com/TheSmiff/Conventional-Generation-Technology/blob/master/Italian%20Energy%20Policy.pptx?raw=true)


The second coursework focussed on thermodynamics of steam plant.

Find the brief here: [Brief.pdf](https://github.com/TheSmiff/Conventional-Generation-Technology/blob/master/Assignment2_2012_steam_plant_part_II.pdf?raw=true)

Find the report here: [Report.pdf](https://github.com/TheSmiff/Conventional-Generation-Technology/blob/master/SteamPlant.pdf?raw=true)

###Contact
For original simulation files: [Thomas J Smith](mailto:tjs1g10@ecs.soton.ac.uk)
